text:
This is how i do it:
Template contains header, Flexible column, footer

Every module I build is full width and i build columns into the module if i need them.

you can then just put what ever module you like into the flexible column

Templates contain modules. You cannot display a module, without putting it in a template.

Modules are the re-usable chunks of code/functionality blocks that store the pages content

Templates put outer structure around the modules, enabling you to have different layouts.
hello
how do I remove the [] ?

assuming you can't just remove it from the nome_do_curso field
you can just use the replace function
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-filters#replace>

`{{ item.nome_do_curso|replace('[','')|replace(']','') }}`

Hello. Is there a way to create a choice field in which we can add values in editor? (Saying we have a tag "resolutions" added to an image of a screen; I want to be able to add a new tag value in editor if this value is not in the preconfigured ones)
this is not working
Hey <@U3T21PDBK>, looks like it's working when you choose a "Select" display, but not as a "Radio" display. Will try to get this fixed :+1:
Thank you!
I deleted and created the field again and returned to normal, but good solution thx :slightly_smiling_face:
TLDR modules are the building blocks of templates. Templates are required to build a page.
pages are required for a website
websites are required for the internet
the internet is required for me
TBH this isn't super clear in the HubSpot documentation. I remember <@U7SL518D6> giving me the :faceplam: when I first started with HubSpot and didn't understand this...
all in love <@U7SL518D6> all in love
i am pretty sure we have all received the :faceplam: from o' jonny boy
<@UD53A9UUR>'s humor is required for me
and Dennis is required for this slack to be entertained.
:point_up:
:pray:
:slightly_smiling_face:

Good feedback on the docs. Keep it coming.

And when you see that lil feedback doo-dad in the docs, we appreciate it when people use it. We especially appreciate when people leave a comment, so we know what about the page we can improve.

We really do read all of it.

true fact: Princess Bride, is definitely my all time favorite movie. I think I’ve memorized almost every line.

When I have kids some day, they too will randomly sputter “you keep using that word. I do not think it means what you think it means.”

And I will randomly sputter “when I was your age, television was called books”
Ha!
McLaren kids.  The horror!!!
